result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmy E Howard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jimmy E Howard in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Jimmy E Howard.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Doctor's report received and filed. Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings. Bail previously set to remain. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jimmy E Howard in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Jimmy E Howard.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Court and parties in receipt of OCRP admission decision. Court orders case adjourned for status of voluntary admission of inpatient treatment.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed, OCRP Admission Decision

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jimmy E Howard in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Jimmy E Howard.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. Goebel appearing via zoom.

Competency Hearing proceeded. Defense does challenge Dr. Goebel's report.  Court qualified Dr. Goebel to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Goebel. Exhibit 1 received. Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.

After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Goebel, and testimony of Dr. Goebel, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent. Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency and refers to Outpatient Competency Restoration Program (OCRP) .   Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Proposed Order forwarded to Judge for signature.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Jimmy E Howard in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  Case in court for return on doctors report. Parties in receipt of examiner's report date 7/26/2022.  State does not dispute the findings, however the defense contests the report and request a competency hearing.  Contested doctors report hearing affirmed with forensic unit.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Jimmy E Howard in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Status Conference Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings  and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. 
 Defendant has scheduled appointment with Dr Jenna Goebel on  7-20-202121 at 12:00on, Room 504 Safety Building.
Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-1-2022

Defendant Jimmy E Howard in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status of counsel. Defense in receipt of discovery and requests time to review and discuss with the defendant. Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Ruby De Leon, received and filed.

Defendant Jimmy E Howard in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Pretrial Conference. Defense Counsel advises the court the defendant wants him to withdraw from the case.
Discussion held with the defendant and advises the court a reason for his request. Defendant will seek to hire private counsel.
Court advises the parties, defense counsel will remain as ocunsel of record until the next court hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report
Pretrial Services Status Report

Defendant Jimmy E Howard in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defendant appeared in person and informed the court he needs an in person date as he does not have Zoom.
Court orders matter adjourned back to Branch 19 for an in person date. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
CHRISTOPHER ERTL, received and filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report

Court ordered no contact with K.H.W
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jimmy E Howard in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Jimmy E Howard in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jimmy E Howard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
